alfredsnippet.snippet:
"The interests model of science is quite a contrast to the traditional model of science as a search for truth which is guided by norms such as skepticism, universality, and communality. The usefulness of these norms for describing science has been questioned (Mulkay, 1976). Indeed, science is possibly just as well described by 'counternorms' such as emotional commitment and organized dogmatism (Mitroff, 1974)."

- Strategies for Dissenting Scientists, Brian Martin, Science and Technology Studies, University of Wollongong, NSW 2522, Australia
